tool.name: BedToIntervalList
tool.description: convert coordinate data into picard interval list format
tool.command:
@java_options@ @symlink_element_identifier@ #set $picard_dict = "localref.dict" #set $ref_fasta = "localref.fa" ## This is done because picards "likes" .fa extension
ln -s "${reference_source.ref_file}" "${ref_fasta}" &&
#if str( $reference_source.reference_source_selector ) == "history":
picard CreateSequenceDictionary REFERENCE="${ref_fasta}" OUTPUT="${picard_dict}" QUIET=true VERBOSITY=ERROR @TMPDIR_OPTION@
&&
#else:
#set $ref_fasta = str( $reference_source.ref_file.fields.path ) ## getting path of reference fasta file (must end with .fa) #set $picard_dict=$ref_fasta[:-2]+"dict" ## replacing .fa with .dict
#end if
picard BedToIntervalList INPUT='$escaped_element_identifier' OUTPUT="${outFile}"
SEQUENCE_DICTIONARY="${picard_dict}" QUIET=true VERBOSITY=ERROR @TMPDIR_OPTION@

validator.message: A built-in dictionary is not available for the build associated with the selected input file

param.name: ref_file
param.label: Use the following dataset to create dictionary
param.help: You can upload a FASTA sequence to the history from which Picard will automatically generate dictionary using CreateSequenceDictionary command

param.name: inputFile
param.label: Select coordinate dataset or dataset collection
param.help: This can be a bed or interval dataset
